summary: This document appears to be an internal report or memo regarding a procedural error at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It describes that the wrong logbook (an "I/M companion log") was used instead of the required "Staff Suicide Watch log" for monitoring an inmate, and that a second, correct log was subsequently completed with identical entries.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: The document is addressed to or involves the Associate Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, indicating it is an internal institutional report.

events.title: Procedural Error in Inmate Monitoring Log
events.description: A staff member assigned to watch an inmate used the wrong logbook (I/M companion log) instead of the required Staff Suicide Watch log. The error was discovered, and a second, correct log was completed with identical entries.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York
locations.context: The federal detention facility where the documented procedural incident occurred.

keyFacts: A procedural error occurred at the MCC New York where staff used an 'I/M companion log' instead of the mandated 'Staff Suicide Watch log' for monitoring an inmate.
The error was discovered, and a second, correct log was created with entries identical to the first, incorrect log.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is addressed to the Associate Warden, indicating it is an internal institutional report.
The document references file identifiers 'SDNY_00010927' and 'EFTA00139535', linking it to the Southern District of New York and the Epstein case document set.
